localised_description.last_approved_text: Is this now or centuries ago? Archaon cares not, his eyes are only on the prize worn by the challenger. Should he win he gains another relic of the Everchosen, the Armour of Morkar himself. But first he must be victorious, and such trials will be anything but easy, for the Dark Gods take great delight in playing with their champions - especially those fated for greatness.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Is this now or centuries ago? Archaon cares not, his eyes are only on the prize worn by the challenger. Should he win he gains another relic of the Everchosen, the Armour of Morkar himself. But first he must be victorious, and such trials will be anything but easy, for the Dark Gods take great delight in playing with their champions - especially those fated for greatness.

localised_description.last_approved_text: While any other of mortal birth would fear a Lord of Change, Archaon cares little. He knows of these creatures that, while they are impressive on the battlefield compared to mundane warriors, it is their arcane might he must vanquish. But when Tzeentch's Greater Daemon is banished back to the Realm of Chaos, leaving the Crown of Domination in its wake, then the End Times will truly begin.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: While any other of mortal birth would fear a Lord of Change, Archaon cares little. localised_description.last_approved_text: To behold the Eye of Sheerian, Archaon must face a dread trial led by a Chaos Lord riding a monstrous steed. The battle will be brutal for the prize is highly valued - be it but another of the Everchosen's Unholy Quests.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: To behold the Eye of Sheerian, Archaon must face a dread trial led by a Chaos Lord riding a monstrous steed. The battle will be brutal for the prize is highly valued - be it but another of the Everchosen's Unholy Quests.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Everchosen faces a powerful magic-user. Should Archaon strike quickly he could kill this Sorcerer King and claim the Slayer of Kings as his reward. But if the warlock lingers he will summon wave after wave of foes to fight against. Even a being such as Archaon could be overwhelmed, in theory at least.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The Everchosen faces a powerful magic-user. Should Archaon strike quickly he could kill this Sorcerer King and claim the Slayer of Kings as his reward. But if the warlock lingers he will summon wave after wave of foes to fight against. Even a being such as Archaon could be overwhelmed, in theory at least.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orcs and the Undead are no match for the mighty Shaggoth. Yet, together they could prove a significant threat. Deal with the fleeing Greenskin mobs quickly, for the Undead will continue to summon more powerful servants to their thrall!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The Orcs and the Undead are no match for the mighty Shaggoth. Yet, together they could prove a significant threat. Deal with the fleeing Greenskin mobs quickly, for the Undead will continue to summon more powerful servants to their thrall!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Sigvald must face the forces of Chaos as he has done many times before. But this time he wants something more than the mere act of murder for murder's sake. The Chaos Lord will not give up his prize so easily, his army will be constantly reinforced, much to his stepfather's delight. This must be a test or trial of sorts!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Sigvald must face the forces of Chaos as he has done many times before. But this time he wants something more than the mere act of murder for murder's sake. The Chaos Lord will not give up his prize so easily, his army will be constantly reinforced, much to his stepfather's delight. This must be a test or trial of sorts!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Prince Sigvald faces the forces of his father's brother-Gods once more. They send forth their most repellent and disgusting beasts in a fit of jealousy and spite. Sigvald's host must face these beasts and by doing so prove he is worthy of a sliver of Slaanesh's very own blade.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Prince Sigvald faces the forces of his father's brother-Gods once more. They send forth their most repellent and disgusting beasts in a fit of jealousy and spite. Sigvald's host must face these beasts and by doing so prove he is worthy of a sliver of Slaanesh's very own blade.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The so-called Middenheimers march in the clumsy way of the uncloven. They come searching for Khazrak; they will find him, but it will be on the Banebeast’s terms, for Khazrak will catch Todbringer and his foolish wolves in an ambush! The Beastlord must be ready to strike at the right moment. One-Eye knows that to launch an attack too early, or even too late, could be the warherd's undoing.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khazrak has caught his rival in-between raids on the man-filth towns. It is an excellent moment to strike - while much of the enemy herd are still in the midst of raiding. Hit Graktar's Gors quickly, for they will be certain to call back the herds to defend their lame master.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This is a tough fight amongst the beast-paths of the darkest forest. Malagor faces a Gorebull and his fierce Minotaur warherd. The Crowfather should use his superior arcane abilities to defeat and dominate the crude but powerful Minotaurs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This battle will be fought against a Knightly Order of the Empire. Armoured man-filth will be a challenge, as they are tough to gore and mobile due to their treacherous beasts. Corner them at the river and deal with them quickly, before reinforcements arrive!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A grand alliance of the Empire and Bretonnia has mustered. It is a desperate act, the dying throes of a race close to extinction. Yet, a cornered beast is at times the most dangerous. Bretonnian cavalry are working in concert with the Empire's artillery and ranked infantry. Caution is advised, for we must strike at the right moment or be undone by this most-disciplined of hosts!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: A grand alliance of the Empire and Bretonnia has mustered. It is a desperate act, the dying throes of a race close to extinction. Yet, a cornered beast is at times the most dangerous. Bretonnian cavalry are working in concert with the Empire's artillery and ranked infantry. Caution is advised, for we must strike at the right moment or be undone by this most-disciplined of hosts!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Volkmar's crusaders have caught the Undead traversing the Fenn. Now is the time to strike and rescue the Jade Griffon from their evil designs. The Vampires will not shun battle, yet Hel Fenn has a cursed history, and one that does not favour the von Carsteins. However, there are plenty of bodies about to summon forth and bolster their shambling hordes, so whilst the Grand Theogonist should strike quickly, the Sigmarites must also be wary of reinforcements.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Volkmar's crusaders have caught the Undead traversing the Fenn. Now is the time to strike and rescue the Jade Griffon from their evil designs. The Vampires will not shun battle, yet Hel Fenn has a cursed history, and one that does not favour the von Carsteins. However, there are plenty of bodies about to summon forth and bolster their shambling hordes, so whilst the Grand Theogonist should strike quickly, the Sigmarites must also be wary of reinforcements.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Emperor is not best pleased that this battle is happening, but for Volkmar's sake he is loath to forbid it. If the enemy general, the Ar-Ulric's loyal servant, be slain then an uneasy peace should quickly follow between the two sides. By the same token, it is clear that the Ar-Ulric wishes the Grand Theogonist dead, thinking his replacement would be more amenable to Ulrican concerns... perhaps. For Volkmar to reclaim his staff it is clear he will need to slay the enemy Lord in Sigmar's name as quickly as possible!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The Emperor is not best pleased that this battle is happening, but for Volkmar's sake he is loath to forbid it. localised_description.last_approved_text: Ghorst has found the Cult of Sigmar's excavation site, where the Arch Lector searches for the lost pages of the Liber Noctus. Once the Cult of Sigmar has the casket that holds the pages, then Ghorst will strike - an ambush to take the Empire men by surprise and rid them of both their lives and the cursed pages! Ghorst's plan is a sound one, but his Vampiress ally counsels caution - the Cult of Sigmar's resources are vast and should the Arch Lector come under attack then reinforcements are likely!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Ghorst has found the Cult of Sigmar's excavation site, where the Arch Lector searches for the lost pages of the Liber Noctus. Once the Cult of Sigmar has the casket that holds the pages, then Ghorst will strike - an ambush to take the Empire men by surprise and rid them of both their lives and the cursed pages! Ghorst's plan is a sound one, but his Vampiress ally counsels caution - the Cult of Sigmar's resources are vast and should the Arch Lector come under attack then reinforcements are likely!

localised_description.last_approved_text: At last an army worthy of restoring Blood Drinker! The vessels are many and so Vlad's sword shall drink deeply. The battlefield is large and open, the Empire's generals think they can outflank and outmanoeuvre the Undead hosts. Vlad should use this learning against them if he is to seek victory.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: At last an army worthy of restoring Blood Drinker! The vessels are many and so Vlad's sword shall drink deeply. The battlefield is large and open, the Empire's generals think they can outflank and outmanoeuvre the Undead hosts. Vlad should use this learning against them if he is to seek victory.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad's hopes of a speedy raid against the mine are thwarted. The site is claimed by a King of the Strigoi and his ghoul swarms - the pathetic legacy of a doomed people that worshipped Nagash as a god. The creature is unimpressed by the Count, refusing to kowtow to Vlad or give him leave to take the warpstone. Vlad's anger rises, and so the Undead will meet each other in battle!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Vlad's hopes of a speedy raid against the mine are thwarted. The site is claimed by a King of the Strigoi and his ghoul swarms - the pathetic legacy of a doomed people that worshipped Nagash as a god. The creature is unimpressed by the Count, refusing to kowtow to Vlad or give him leave to take the warpstone. Vlad's anger rises, and so the Undead will meet each other in battle!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These pathetic forest-dwelling Elves come for Morghur, but he must hold fast. The ritual is well underway - he cannot let Ariel and her minions take from him that which he has toiled over for so long. Morghur is beset, but the position is defensible; the waves of Elves will come and crash upon the Beastmen as waves crash upon the rocks. They shall leave nothing for Ariel to identify them by. A Ruinous power flows through Morghur, so that he might smite the Elven pretenders with Chaotic fury!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: These pathetic forest-dwelling Elves come for Morghur, but he must hold fast. The ritual is well underway - he cannot let Ariel and her minions take from him that which he has toiled over for so long. Morghur is beset, but the position is defensible; the waves of Elves will come and crash upon the Beastmen as waves crash upon the rocks. They shall leave nothing for Ariel to identify them by. A Ruinous power flows through Morghur, so that he might smite the Elven pretenders with Chaotic fury!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves are beset by tribulation! The Undead are swift and nimble; they will be upon Durthu's allies in short order! Whilst they can hold on for now, he must move swiftly to aid them or they will be completely overrun by the Undead menace. The Ashenhall is a craggy, obstacle-laden place, with many natural points of defence - the terrain is advantageous to he who holds it. Durthu must hold the enemy at bay until the Elves can regroup, then together they can smite the eldritch blight from these lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The foul stench of Necromancy infects every inch of this accursed field. If the glades are to be restored to their former sanctity, this scourge must be expunged. Yet the Eldest of Ancients must take care; more Undead will filter onto the field as the Necromancer takes hold of more cadavers. Durthu must strike fast and cut the head from this serpent. The Necromancer himself must fall, for it is he who controls these shuffling thralls. Once he is gone, they will soon lose their sense of purpose. One fell strike with all the strength of the Ancients behind him and Durthu will see this blight excised and the forests restored!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

localised_description.last_approved_text: So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Glade Lord is beyond salvation! She has given herself wholly to the dark lord Slaanesh; she is nothing more than a puppet of Chaos now, she must be purged! Her retinue lies across from Orion, but there will doubtless be more coming to her aid. This aid will not take the form of Elves, however, as the Ruinous Powers seek to secure their fleeting foothold on this realm. Dark and corrupted forces will try to stop Orion in his endeavour, but he must hold firm against them all and recover the relic before it is snatched away beyond his reach.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The herd, and Morghur with it, had no idea that Orion and his warriors had located and infiltrated their secret beast-paths. And so the Elves descend upon them with pride and vengeance in their hearts. However, they are deep within enemy territory now and do not know from which direction further Beastmen may come to aid their brothers and forestall Elven vengeance. And so Orion must be swift, he must be strong and above all he must be furious; let the rage of the ancient forest of Athel Loren rain destruction upon these calamitous fiends, that they never darken the forest again.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These violent desires must not come to fruition. Orion is all that stands between the Oak of Ages and the utter ruin of Athel Loren. They will come from the south, intent on breaking through Orion's defences and attacking the Oak, but the King will stand firm. Indeed he must, for the alternative is the destruction of the forest as he knows it. Yet Anath Raema is determined, she will see the rebel band is reinforced with her minions where possible. Orion and his forces must be ever-vigilant, although with all of Athel Loren behind him and the power of Ariel within his soul he cannot fail. He will not fail! He will see these dark desires meet a violent end and peace return to Athel Loren's gentle glades.

They will come from the south, intent on breaking through Orion's defences and attacking the Oak, but the King will stand firm. Indeed he must, for the alternative is the destruction of the forest as he knows it. Yet Anath Raema is determined, she will see the rebel band is reinforced with her minions where possible. Orion and his forces must be ever-vigilant, although with all of Athel Loren behind him and the power of Ariel within his soul he cannot fail. He will not fail! He will see these dark desires meet a violent end and peace return to Athel Loren's gentle glades.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A mighty battle awaits, for the prize is great! The urks will not make this easy, for they have gathered in great numbers and, as news of the Dwarfs coming spreads across the rest of the Peaks, more Greenskins will no doubt come to join the fray. This is Ironhammer's moment - should he be victorious, then he could well be the first of the Angrund line to wield King Lunn’s hammer in generations!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskins sought to use the ancient halls of Belegar's Ancestors as a means to wreak havoc in the Karaz Ankor, but instead it is they who are undone - caught within the realms of the Dwarfs and trapped. Allies from Karak Azul will take the urks from behind. It is our job to face the urks head on and crush them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs despise Skarsnik, and with good reason. They will fight hard, so the Warlord must use his superior deployment to outflank the bearded gits. Be wary of any reinforcements. As all gobbos know, Dwarfs have small legs so there's always a few running to catch up!

Be wary of any reinforcements. As all gobbos know, Dwarfs have small legs so there's always a few running to catch up!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Here come the stunties again, but there's more of them and they seem even angrier than before. Good! Such dark emotions will further empower Skarsnik's new prodder, making the artefact even more spiteful. First, though, he must be victorious. The flanking worked last time, but will the stubborn Dwarfs fall for the same 'tricksy trap' a second time?

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Here come the stunties again, but there's more of them and they seem even angrier than before. Good! localised_description.last_approved_text: At last! The false prophet has stopped hiding like a coward, and is forced to face Wurrzag. The Goblin and has taken position on a hill, where he’ll be difficult to shift. But just before Wurrzag commits to battle, he falls into a trance - Gork is talking to him. The Great Green God warns his Shaman that the sneaky Gobbo is laying a trap and more of his mates are skulking close by. Gits!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: At last! The false prophet has stopped hiding like a coward, and is forced to face Wurrzag. The Goblin and has taken position on a hill, where he’ll be difficult to shift. But just before Wurrzag commits to battle, he falls into a trance - Gork is talking to him. The Great Green God warns his Shaman that the sneaky Gobbo is laying a trap and more of his mates are skulking close by. Gits!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Blackfire Pass is a place of legend. Not only is it the scene of many a battle, its mountainsides are riddled with ancient Dwarf Halls and lost dungeons. These catacombs are prime quest territory for parties of adventurers searching for riches and lost heirlooms. One such party has emerged into the gloomy daylight to see Wurrzag’s army gathering in the pass. To take Wurrzag’s head as a prize, to deliver it before the Imperial throne, would be a great bounty. And so the heroes decide to attack, but they are not foolish enough to believe they can fight this hoard alone, they fight with a rapidly-approaching Empire army at their backs!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Blackfire Pass is a place of legend. Not only is it the scene of many a battle, its mountainsides are riddled with ancient Dwarf Halls and lost dungeons. These catacombs are prime quest territory for parties of adventurers searching for riches and lost heirlooms. One such party has emerged into the gloomy daylight to see Wurrzag’s army gathering in the pass. To take Wurrzag’s head as a prize, to deliver it before the Imperial throne, would be a great bounty. And so the heroes decide to attack, but they are not foolish enough to believe they can fight this hoard alone, they fight with a rapidly-approaching Empire army at their backs!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gashtooth’s army gathers to face Wurrzag’s boyz. Suspiciously, there doesn’t seem to be anyone about... yet. Wurrzag’s scout re-joins the force, looking worse for wear. He tried to use his ‘in-ish-a-tive’ to capture one of these soopa-Squigs but the beast got so angry it exploded! Looks like these mushrooms may harbour some lethal side-effects!\n\nAs the Greenskin hordes prepare to charge each other Gashtooth produces the Squiggly Beast. In a taunting gesture he shows Wurrzag’s pet a glowing mushroom. The beast - always hungry - tries to grab the mushroom but it is kept tantalisingly out of reach. If Wurrzag wants his pet back - and unchanged - he needs to attack now! Waaagh!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This rogue Knight and his army sit in a most defensible position on the far side of the battlefield from the Duke's own force. Between them is an open field offering little cover. Beyond that Alberic must face the steeled, readied mercenary Knights. He must also beware of the guns used by these brigands – they would rather shoot from afar than fight with honour and courage. Yet, if Alberic holds true, then no force can forestall his judgement!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: This rogue Knight and his army sit in a most defensible position on the far side of the battlefield from the Duke's own force. Between them is an open field offering little cover. Beyond that Alberic must face the steeled, readied mercenary Knights. He must also beware of the guns used by these brigands – they would rather shoot from afar than fight with honour and courage. Yet, if Alberic holds true, then no force can forestall his judgement!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our march through the Chaos Wastes have been tough, Sire, but at last our courage seems to have been rewarded. Along the Cliff of Beasts, our scouts return with news that the forces of Ruin have decided to meet us in battle. Led by Archaon the Everchosen, and accompanied by the Prince of Slaneesh, Sigvald the Magnificent, the Chaos army seem ready to offer us a fight for the ages! The skies above, ever ominous during our perilous journey, turn now even more despondent. Thunder rolls across the grizzly clouds, and in the distance, lightning arcs through the deepening sky. The air hisses with static; could this be the moment of our destiny?

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Our march through the Chaos Wastes have been tough, Sire, but at last our courage seems to have been rewarded. Along the Cliff of Beasts, our scouts return with news that the forces of Ruin have decided to meet us in battle. Led by Archaon the Everchosen, and accompanied by the Prince of Slaneesh, Sigvald the Magnificent, the Chaos army seem ready to offer us a fight for the ages! The skies above, ever ominous during our perilous journey, turn now even more despondent. Thunder rolls across the grizzly clouds, and in the distance, lightning arcs through the deepening sky. The air hisses with static; could this be the moment of our destiny?

localised_description.last_approved_text: My Lord! The outriders have returned from their reconnaissance with reports of a Greenskin force massing ahead of us. They are encamped on a defensible ridge, and have brought their bizarre artillery to further fortify the position – they appear ready to fight to the last. Further reports seem to indicate that they are bolstered by a great gathering of Warbosses, who seem bent on bringing their full strength to bear against you. It is clear they want the same thing we do – a decisive battle to decide our fates once and for all. We must not relent – their scourge must be wiped from the world!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: My Lord! The outriders have returned from their reconnaissance with reports of a Greenskin force massing ahead of us. They are encamped on a defensible ridge, and have brought their bizarre artillery to further fortify the position – they appear ready to fight to the last. Further reports seem to indicate that they are bolstered by a great gathering of Warbosses, who seem bent on bringing their full strength to bear against you. It is clear they want the same thing we do – a decisive battle to decide our fates once and for all. We must not relent – their scourge must be wiped from the world!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Although the Fay Enchantress did much and more with her potion, summoning a spell of unmatched power, the fiends of Chaos still managed to land on Bretonnian shores, though in numbers much diminished. Their force still poses great danger, however, if it is not defeated here.\n\nThe effects of the potion yet linger upon the beleaguered enemy, however, which gives the Bretonnians an edge. The Fay Enchantress has spent much of her strength on the storm that destroyed the fleet, yet the Winds of Magic still blow strong; she should be able to continue to attack them through magical means. Though they are numerous, the Chaos hordes are fatigued and susceptible to attack; take advantage of this and show them no quarter - the ocean is only retreat for them!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Although the Fay Enchantress did much and more with her potion, summoning a spell of unmatched power, the fiends of Chaos still managed to land on Bretonnian shores, though in numbers much diminished. Their force still poses great danger, however, if it is not defeated here.\n\nThe effects of the potion yet linger upon the beleaguered enemy, however, which gives the Bretonnians an edge. The Fay Enchantress has spent much of her strength on the storm that destroyed the fleet, yet the Winds of Magic still blow strong; she should be able to continue to attack them through magical means. Though they are numerous, the Chaos hordes are fatigued and susceptible to attack; take advantage of this and show them no quarter - the ocean is only retreat for them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The source of this vile mist is made apparent, yet here at its source it is thicker and more obfuscating than ever. At the heart of the fog lies a great army of Greenskins who can be heard beyond the obscuring effluvium with much yelling, grunting, clattering, zogging and twatting. Bretonnian Knights have thus far managed to hold back all incursions into their precious realm, yet the stakes are even higher now; the fate of Bretonnia itself hangs in the balance, for Zugrak Gobspit and his deadly Skullsmasherz have arrived. They are far more deadly than the average standard chaotic Greenskin host, so caution is advised lest the enemy surround and destroy the Bretonnian forces, their advances hidden beneath the all-consuming murk.

They are far more deadly than the average standard chaotic Greenskin host, so caution is advised lest the enemy surround and destroy the Bretonnian forces, their advances hidden beneath the all-consuming murk.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs plant their oath stones at a crossroads - a defiant gesture to the creatures of Troll Country. The throng will not be moved until the cull has happened. The Dawi will stand firm as wave after wave of monsters are drawn to what they think is prey. It will be a long haul, but the purge must happen!

The throng will not be moved until the cull has happened. The Dawi will stand firm as wave after wave of monsters are drawn to what they think is prey. It will be a long haul, but the purge must happen!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Speed will win the day here, not always a Dwarfen characteristic, but perhaps recent innovations will plug that gap? In any case, those filthy grobi magic-users are making some ritual, they must be disrupted, and quickly, or no doubt tougher reinforcements will follow.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Speed will win the day here, not always a Dwarfen characteristic, but perhaps recent innovations will plug that gap? In any case, those filthy grobi magic-users are making some ritual, they must be disrupted, and quickly, or no doubt tougher reinforcements will follow.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This is a fell place. It reeks of dead umgi. Of the enemy, there is no sign yet... But Thorgrim must attend to claim vengeance on innocent Dawi that did nothing but travelled through the area to make a just profit. The High King has sworn that the Dammaz Kron will stay shut until vengeance is claimed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Thorgrim must defend the pass, as his ancestors have done many times before. Let us hope that the umgi will heed the summons and send forth their own warriors. In the meantime the High King's throng must fight and hold back the green tide.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Thorgrim must defend the pass, as his ancestors have done many times before. Let us hope that the umgi will heed the summons and send forth their own warriors. In the meantime the High King's throng must fight and hold back the green tide.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The King must make his way through the Underway, an area under the dominion of urks and grobi. Be wary of the side passages, for it stinks of an ambush, even if the Everpeak Aircorps is en route to offer support.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ungrim will meet the Chaos scum in the high peaks of his mountain realm. This will be battle hard won, for the Northmen come as if sent by the Chaos Gods themselves to end the discordant song within the Axe of Dargo. A bitter fight then, and one the Slayer King must win!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No more guile, now is the time to match blades in open battle. This horde is heavy with Orcs, but there are Trolls within the ranks too. Good! For what is the use of a Troll-slayer if there are no Trolls to slay!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These fell Uzkular may not be the object of Ungrim's Quest, yet they represent a threat to the forces of order and so must be slain all the same. The howls of long-dead wolves play across the battlefield and it is clear that the robed figure and two more of his vile brethren are close.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Undead adopt a defensive stance around their Lord. Pale skeletal warriors await the Dwarfs in a silence broken only by mindless moans of numberless Zombies and the feral cackling of Ghouls and other nameless horrors. Ungrim must strike, and strike now - for who knows what is being called to Undeath from within the cave.

There are Undead here, of that there is no question, but what great monster has been summoned from its deathbed deep in the cave, Gelt is convinced he's about to find out...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Chaos horde are not going to let a Patriarch of the Empire swoop in and take their prize. Balthasar must face the might of a mounted Chaos army led by a Chaos Lord in full raiment. This Champion of Chaos will gain much favour from his dark masters by slaying such a powerful servant of Franz. The battle will be bloody indeed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gelt must prepare for an arcane duel. Orr has always been a powerful rival, and highly-capable mage. He is sure to attack early, so Gelt must prepare his magical defences. He must also be especially wary, as the ambush will not be the only part of Orr's plan - he will have something else up his white robe...

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Gelt must prepare for an arcane duel. Orr has always been a powerful rival, and highly-capable mage. He is sure to attack early, so Gelt must prepare his magical defences. He must also be especially wary, as the ambush will not be the only part of Orr's plan - he will have something else up his white robe...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Karl Franz has so far shunned the use of Ghal Maraz - symbol of the Emperor - for fear of further angering those hostile to his coronation. But should he be victorious this day, then the warhammer can be claimed with clear conscience! But first he must face a massive army of Orcs and Goblins in Black Fire Pass, just as Sigmar did before him; and as with Sigmar over two thousand years ago, he hopes that the Dwarfs will be there as allies!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Karl Franz has so far shunned the use of Ghal Maraz - symbol of the Emperor - for fear of further angering those hostile to his coronation. But should he be victorious this day, then the warhammer can be claimed with clear conscience! But first he must face a massive army of Orcs and Goblins in Black Fire Pass, just as Sigmar did before him; and as with Sigmar over two thousand years ago, he hopes that the Dwarfs will be there as allies!

localised_description.last_approved_text: So it is, the Empire must fight against its own kind for survival within the bounds of the Empire itself. We must be wary for there are more than traitors lurking in Bloodpine Woods.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: So it is, the Empire must fight against its own kind for survival within the bounds of the Empire itself. We must be wary for there are more than traitors lurking in Bloodpine Woods.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The coast of Nordland has been ravaged by Norse raiders, but no longer! Franz knows this is a test of his sovereignty, that the unconvinced Electors will be watching and even hoping he fails. So he must face the Norsemen and be victorious. They will come in waves, like the very sea itself!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The coast of Nordland has been ravaged by Norse raiders, but no longer! localised_description.last_approved_text: That hill, Grudsnik's Mound, is the key. And the humies are camped on it. But these humies like their nags, no doubt they're behind the hill ready to flank Azhag's force. But Azhag wasn't born yesterday - he don't know when 'ee woz born! - he'll need to make sure the humies and nags don't catch him off guard - smash the hill-based gits before the pincer closes!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: That hill, Grudsnik's Mound, is the key. And the humies are camped on it. But these humies like their nags, no doubt they're behind the hill ready to flank Azhag's force. But Azhag wasn't born yesterday - he don't know when 'ee woz born! - he'll need to make sure the humies and nags don't catch him off guard - smash the hill-based gits before the pincer closes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This city is evil, even for an Orc of Azhag's temperament. Yet the loot in the city is worth the risk, even if that risk is facing against Chaos and the Undead. The Chaos forces will be attacking from within the ruins, Gork knows where the Undead will be striking from! Watch the skies, for they will be full of "vile fings".

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: This city is evil, even for an Orc of Azhag's temperament. Yet the loot in the city is worth the risk, even if that risk is facing against Chaos and the Undead. The Chaos forces will be attacking from within the ruins, Gork knows where the Undead will be striking from! Watch the skies, for they will be full of "vile fings".

localised_description.last_approved_text: This is where the Slaughterer's name was first screamed in terror by the wretches of the Empire. But to earn that title Azhag must fight! The Warboss will face two armies of humies, and will even confront a deadly steam tank. Should he be victorious he will be etched into the bloody history of the Empire!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: This is where the Slaughterer's name was first screamed in terror by the wretches of the Empire. But to earn that title Azhag must fight! The Warboss will face two armies of humies, and will even confront a deadly steam tank. Should he be victorious he will be etched into the bloody history of the Empire!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Orcs may be savages but they have yet to face the Slaughterer. Those on the hill are a formidable force, but will not be the only enemies in the forthcoming battle. Azhag must be wary of the flanks, for this is where the savages will surely strike once the hill attack begins.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: These Orcs may be savages but they have yet to face the Slaughterer. Those on the hill are a formidable force, but will not be the only enemies in the forthcoming battle. Azhag must be wary of the flanks, for this is where the savages will surely strike once the hill attack begins.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grimgor must take on two separate stunty forces. Something he is more than capable of doing, but if the bearded gits try and play it sneaky, he may end up outmanoeuvred. These armies are not just keeping their squat legs on the ground either. Gobbo lookerz report lots of Gyrocopter squads. Cheating beardy gits.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Grimgor must take on two separate stunty forces. Something he is more than capable of doing, but if the bearded gits try and play it sneaky, he may end up outmanoeuvred. These armies are not just keeping their squat legs on the ground either. Gobbo lookerz report lots of Gyrocopter squads. Cheating beardy gits.

localised_description.last_approved_text: While others quail at the thought of fighting Chaos, for Grimgor this is more than a mere challenge - it is an absolute joy! Be wary though, if the Northmen worship the Blood God then it'll be a straight-up scrap, but if they are dedicated to one of the sneakier powers, then there may be a few surprises or even traps to confront.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: While others quail at the thought of fighting Chaos, for Grimgor this is more than a mere challenge - it is an absolute joy! Be wary though, if the Northmen worship the Blood God then it'll be a straight-up scrap, but if they are dedicated to one of the sneakier powers, then there may be a few surprises or even traps to confront.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beyond Black Fire Pass stands the lush humie realms, ripe for stomping. But first Grimgor must break through this army. The humies will be hard to shift, and there are rumours that they'll be getting stunty reinforcements. All things to consider, since Grimgor's force is all here with nothing left in reserve.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Beyond Black Fire Pass stands the lush humie realms, ripe for stomping. But first Grimgor must break through this army. The humies will be hard to shift, and there are rumours that they'll be getting stunty reinforcements. All things to consider, since Grimgor's force is all here with nothing left in reserve.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dwarfs travelling along this lost dark road are ripe for an ambush. Don't let the beardy gits form a defensive perimeter. Get 'em in the flanks nice an' early and den smack 'em from behind with da big stuff!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Dwarfs travelling along this lost dark road are ripe for an ambush. Don't let the beardy gits form a defensive perimeter. Get 'em in the flanks nice an' early and den smack 'em from behind with da big stuff!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Kemmler's host step onto the frozen lake, the Lichemaster spots more minions of the Ruinous Powers hacking their way into the ice seeking out Krell's tomb. In response to his approach, the Marauders abandon their excavation and ready their weapons. It is a small force, and will quickly be overwhelmed. This is almost too easy!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: As Kemmler's host step onto the frozen lake, the Lichemaster spots more minions of the Ruinous Powers hacking their way into the ice seeking out Krell's tomb. In response to his approach, the Marauders abandon their excavation and ready their weapons. It is a small force, and will quickly be overwhelmed. This is almost too easy!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kemmler decides the best way to rid Marbad's Tomb of the Goblin infestation is to lay a trap. His minions lie in wait - an ambush for the Goblinoids! When the Greenskins approach, via the channel between the hillsides, the Lichemaster will strike!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Kemmler decides the best way to rid Marbad's Tomb of the Goblin infestation is to lay a trap. His minions lie in wait - an ambush for the Goblinoids! When the Greenskins approach, via the channel between the hillsides, the Lichemaster will strike!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kemmler will use the Empire puppets to confront the Bretonnians. Let the foolish Knights smash their lances against the corpses of the broken Empire. When he strikes with the full might of the Undead, the abbey's secrets will be his!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Kemmler will use the Empire puppets to confront the Bretonnians. Let the foolish Knights smash their lances against the corpses of the broken Empire. When he strikes with the full might of the Undead, the abbey's secrets will be his!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This area is deep in Savage Orc territory. The brutes stand guardian over their pathetic effigies atop a hill. A strong legion will send the green fools scattering, so we must be wary of any reinforcements that may come from the flanks. Assuming such savages have that foresight, of course.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: This area is deep in Savage Orc territory. The brutes stand guardian over their pathetic effigies atop a hill. A strong legion will send the green fools scattering, so we must be wary of any reinforcements that may come from the flanks. Assuming such savages have that foresight, of course.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Undead legion marches west under the fearsome banner of von Carstein. Mannfred is determined to claim the Armour of Templehof from Grudsnik's tomb and will slay any mortal fool who gets in his way! Let the mortals think they can outwit the Count with flanking attacks. Mannfred is ancient, and has seen such archaic tactics many times before.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The Undead legion marches west under the fearsome banner of von Carstein. Mannfred is determined to claim the Armour of Templehof from Grudsnik's tomb and will slay any mortal fool who gets in his way! Let the mortals think they can outwit the Count with flanking attacks. Mannfred is ancient, and has seen such archaic tactics many times before.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Hel Fenn, a place Mannfred is not fond of for historical reasons. But these mortals pose no such threat! They are few in number and while they have a strong position between two rocks, they can be flanked easily enough. It will not take long for these fools to join our Unliving ranks!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: Hel Fenn, a place Mannfred is not fond of for historical reasons. But these mortals pose no such threat! They are few in number and while they have a strong position between two rocks, they can be flanked easily enough. It will not take long for these fools to join our Unliving ranks!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The slaughter of so many Greenskins close to an Arcane Fulcrum should provide the right conditions for the Count to bind the necromantic energy into an artefact. He must destroy this Goblin Shaman and his underlings defending the pillar and do it before any Greenskin reinforcements arrive!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The slaughter of so many Greenskins close to an Arcane Fulcrum should provide the right conditions for the Count to bind the necromantic energy into an artefact. He must destroy this Goblin Shaman and his underlings defending the pillar and do it before any Greenskin reinforcements arrive!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This is a battle of bitter foes - there is more than mere honour at stake. The White Dwarf has encountered this Chaos Dragon before, when the fell creature struck the Ancestor Lord, shattering Glimril scales from Grombrindal's armour. Such a slight cannot remain unaccounted for - defeating the Chaos Lord will allow the White Dwarf to recover the scales and complete his armour once more. Such a thing is no easy task - Marbad's Tomb has seen much blood spilt and this battle will be no different. These Beastmen thralls are no ordinary Gors, and Tzeentch has supplied his servant with more than one surprise...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The White Dwarf faces a massive Chaos army, the like of which has not been seen in many years. Grombrindal and his throng steel themselves for the task ahead; he is glad its ranks are so numerous as he must slay many to fulfil his oath!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The White Dwarf faces a massive Chaos army, the like of which has not been seen in many years. Grombrindal and his throng steel themselves for the task ahead; he is glad its ranks are so numerous as he must slay many to fulfil his oath!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Undead army is revealed and the White Dwarf is keen to halt this trespass into Valaya's realm. It is no surprise to Grombrindal that these dead urks are led by a Vampire. That must be dealt with quickly, but the rune that now glows brightly on the White Dwarf's cloak foretells that several waves of Undead are to be expected.

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The Undead army is revealed and the White Dwarf is keen to halt this trespass into Valaya's realm. It is no surprise to Grombrindal that these dead urks are led by a Vampire. That must be dealt with quickly, but the rune that now glows brightly on the White Dwarf's cloak foretells that several waves of Undead are to be expected.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The forces of Karak Azul are already in the midst of fighting when Grombrindal's throng deploys. It was a dangerous task, but one the proud Dwarfs of that Hold willingly volunteered for. However, now the White Dwarf must come to their aid or risk dishonour!\n\nAs Gotrek previously warned, this Greenskin horde is full of monsters -a fetish of the Warboss, but one that the Dawi will easily overcome. Thundering Falls makes for a perfect trap through which to take on such creatures, which is why it was chosen, but hopefully the Warboss was not canny enough to keep back any monstrous reserves!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: The forces of Karak Azul are already in the midst of fighting when Grombrindal's throng deploys. It was a dangerous task, but one the proud Dwarfs of that Hold willingly volunteered for. However, now the White Dwarf must come to their aid or risk dishonour!\n\nAs Gotrek previously warned, this Greenskin horde is full of monsters -a fetish of the Warboss, but one that the Dawi will easily overcome. Thundering Falls makes for a perfect trap through which to take on such creatures, which is why it was chosen, but hopefully the Warboss was not canny enough to keep back any monstrous reserves!

localised_description.last_approved_text: On this occasion, the fury of the Beastmen is unmatched, as is their strength. Isabella and her forces must pick their adversaries carefully, lest their strength and unnatural bravery sees her army put to rout. Yet there is strength in sending her Undead hordes against this savage enemy - they can be summoned from their graves to do the Countess' bidding without protest or question. With the Undead at her command, Isabella will surely emerge victorious!

battle_set_pieces.localised_description: On this occasion, the fury of the Beastmen is unmatched, as is their strength. localised_name.last_approved_text: Blood Chalice of Bathori: The Dead Wood

battle_set_pieces.localised_name: Blood Chalice of Bathori: The Dead Wood

localised_description.last_approved_text: These ignorant Empire guards are ill-prepared to face Isabella's fury - there is no rage like that of the Vampire Countess, and she has much to dispense. Beyond them lies the tomb of Marbad the First Elector - who knows what has happened to him since his interment? The weak, pathetic Sigmarite soldiers may not even know what it is they defend!
